headline.main: Better Health for the Nation's Truckers

docs.abstract: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.
docs.snippet: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.

headline.main: Better Health for the Nation's Truckers

docs.abstract: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.
docs.lead_paragraph: On the road for weeks on end, with poor diets and little exercise, the nation's truckers are in pretty bad shape, reports Abby Ellin in this week's Science Times.
docs.snippet: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.

headline.seo: Eylea, a Vision Drug, Wins Long-Sought Approval
headline.print_headline: Success Long in Coming For a Vision Treatment
headline.main: Success Long in Coming for Eylea, a Vision Treatment

docs.abstract: Regeneron Pharmaceuticals wins approval from the Food and Drug Administration for its drug Eylea, which treats wet form of age-related macular degeneration; approval comes after years of research and $1.2 billion in losses.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal approval of Eylea came after years of research and a total $1.2 billion in losses.
docs.snippet: The federal approval of Eylea came after years of research and a total $1.2 billion in losses.

docs.abstract: Editorial urges pushback from the Obama administration against food industry lobbyists attempting to undermine proposed voluntary standards aimed at curbing childhood obesity by limiting the way unhealthy foods are marketed to children.
docs.lead_paragraph: Instead of giving in to lobbyists, the Obama administration should be doing more to limit the way unhealthy foods are marketed to children.
docs.snippet: Instead of giving in to lobbyists, the Obama administration should be doing more to limit the way unhealthy foods are marketed to children.

headline.seo: Smokers Penalized With Health Insurance Premiums

docs.abstract: Some companies are starting to penalize employees who smoke or are obese by raising their health insurance costs; policies that impose financial penalties on employees have doubled in the last two years to 19 percent of 248 major American employers surveyed.
docs.lead_paragraph: Some companies are starting to penalize employees who smoke or are obese by raising their health insurance costs.
docs.snippet: Some companies are starting to penalize employees who smoke or are obese by raising their health insurance costs.

docs.abstract: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.
docs.snippet: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

docs.abstract: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Atlantic Cities: A geographic-economic analysis of where the best restaurants in the world are. The urban theorist Richard Florida links great food to "the open and tolerant values that go with a creative, knowledge-based economy." -- Julia Moskin
docs.snippet: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

headline.seo: Congress Blocks New Rules on School Lunches
headline.print_headline: Congress Blocks New Rules on School Lunches
headline.main: Congress Blocks New Rules on School Lunches

docs.abstract: Federal lawmakers drafting a House and Senate compromise for the Agriculture Department's spending bill block the agency from overhauling the nation's school lunch program; proposed rules would have added more fruits and vegetables to lunch menus, and lowered amounts of sodium and potatoes, in an effort to reduce childhood obesity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Congress blocked changes proposed by the Agriculture Department that were meant to reduce childhood obesity.
docs.snippet: Congress blocked changes proposed by the Agriculture Department that were meant to reduce childhood obesity.

headline.main: For Weight Loss, a Recipe of Teamwork and Trust

docs.abstract: If you want to adopt and maintain better habits, it’s better not to go it alone.
docs.snippet: If you want to adopt and maintain better habits, it’s better not to go it alone.

headline.main: For Weight Loss, a Recipe of Teamwork and Trust

docs.abstract: If you want to adopt and maintain better habits, it's better not to go it alone.
docs.lead_paragraph: On Friday I wrote about Saddleback Church, which is using its small groups as an infrastructure to help its members lose weight and live healthier lives. The megachurch has megaplans for this idea - the church's pastor, the Rev. Rick Warren, hopes to expand it through the worldwide network of thousands of churches that are affiliated with Saddleback and the 150,000 pastors who subscribe to his newsletter.
docs.snippet: If you want to adopt and maintain better habits, it's better not to go it alone.
